intro: Nassauvia abbreviatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Nassauvia abbreviatum is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
